p: This translates, for example, into a predicted seroprevalence of 57% (55%–62%) at a population density of 10 persons per km 2, compared to 32% (23%–38%) at a population density of 500 persons per km 2 ( Figure 1C). Village random effects were not spatially correlated, and including spatial dependency did not improve model fit ( File S1, Figure A1).
